text: Brian James Johnson (26 June 1956 - 11 January 2016) was an Australian professional rugby league player and coach. He was born in Dapto, New South Wales. He played as a fullback. He played in Sydney for the St George Dragons and Eastern Suburbs. He later played in England for Warrington. Johnson died from Alzheimer's disease on 11 January 2016 in Wollongong, aged 59. ==References== Category:1956 births Category:2016 deaths Category:Australian rugby league players Category:Deaths from Alzheimer's disease Category:Disease-related deaths in New South Wales Category:Sportspeople from New South Wales
title: Brian Johnson (rugby league)
